I wish I had friends. I wish I had friends so badly. I wish I had friends that would do fun things with me, I wish I had a girlfriend, and most of all I wish I had the willpower to overcome my laziness so I can get out there and follow my dreams. I sit in my room for days on end daydreaming, daydreaming about things that I could be doing in literally five seconds. I daydream about painting, reading, writing; I have paints, canvases, paper and books. Why can't I do anything? I sit in front of the computer screen with my homework up, writing an essay in my head that will never reach the page. For literally a year I've daydreamed about getting my temps; the Bmv is at the corner of my block. I think about running when actually running is a door and a hallway away. I have friends in my mind. There is this girl I saw a while ago in passing and she was absolutely beautiful. I've created a personality for her. In my mind we have a deep, complex, ideal relationship. I don't even know her name so I gave her one. I think I'm making progress in my life, I do more things with each passing day, but the improvement is moving at a snails pace, I can't afford to continue to have my life drowned out by passivity and mediocrity. As I write this I realize that I don't want to die‚Äî I want to live, and my suicidal ideation stems from the shame I have of not being anybody. This is probably where I should end it, but I want to write about a few more things I'd like to do. I love politics. I'm very politically conscious and I want to be an activist, I have ideas of how I could change the world for the better‚Äî but I didn't even attend a George Floyd protest. I don't have the temperament to be a leader, hell, I don't have the temperament to function in life; everything is overwhelming. I've failed three classes in high school. I don't think I'm that stupid, I scored well on the psat and all standardized tests I've taken throughout my life. Now I know that these don't measure intelligence very accurately but I've consistently scored in the 90th percentile or higher and I can't tell if it's the excellent school that I attend or if I'm actually not dumb. I feel so stupid. I feel constantly out classed by my peers, and I am intimidated by them. I don't know what I am trying to achieve by writing this novel, but if any of you have found yourself in a similar predicament where you don't act on your dreams please give me your advise (especially if you've gotten out of this rut). Sorry I wrote a novel. Tl;dr: I'm lazy as hell and I can't escape my laziness. Seeking advise.

Death is a mercy I do not deserve. I've been having suicidal thoughts for years now though had only recently been diagnosed psychologically; didn't wanna burden my parents with the astronomical psychologist/psychiatrist fees in my country. I must also confess that I am a compulsory truant when it comes to appointments with my psychologist and school counselors for pretty much the same reason. They can't charge me if I don't book appointments in the first place). I wanna kill myself. This thought has been a constant companion for years now that at this point it's almost a hobby. In my spare time, I've contemplated and devised almost every possible way to accomplish that in my home quarantine situation. I've calculated how much isopropyl alcohol I would need to ingest in one go in order to guarantee a slow painful death by poisoning. I've tested the strength of every possible attachment point for a noose to see if it can support my fat ass. I've determined whenever the person with the noisy ass sports car is most likely to get out of the house (to work or something idk their life) so that I can potentially jump in front of  their speeding car (ruled this option out cuz I don't wanna traumatize them). I even figured out how to ensure that my family members don't catch me in the middle of offing myself before death embraces me. I guess my quarantine hobby has been ideating lol. I can't remember how it started but nowadays, I want to die because I hate myself. Plain and simple. I can't seem to love myself in any capacity. I want to. I really do. I don't wanna be a hypocrite. I see so much beauty and wonder in others, who by their very nature of being human, are automatically wonderful and fascinating to me. But I cannot spare any of that for myself. Idiot. Disappointment. Coward. Sloth. Burden. Failure. Damaged goods. Hypocrite. Emotionally constipated. Man-child. Degenerate. A bad investment. These are the things I tell myself when I'm at my most vulnerable, which rn seems to be a continuous norm. People say this will past. Hell no. I've done everything. I've talked to friends and family and they've yet to convince me that these thoughts are irrational as much as they've tried. If any, I feel worse because of how much I make them worry when they shouldn't. I'm not worth their time. I've sought professional help but the costs are just way too much for continuous visits. Medications aren't working as much as they used to and stronger ones are expensive here. I've tried many hobbies and pursued what was once my passion. Every method has since fallen through especially this year. Early this year, my mom died and I haven't been able to feel anything other than anxiety and self-hatred. To make her proud was pretty much the only thing motivating me and now she's gone. I also feel guilty for her death (I can't expound to conceal my identity. I don't want anyone who knows me who's lurking around here on reddit to get worried). Before, the aforementioned support methods may have worked. But nothing works anymore nowadays. Right now, I'm really contemplating suicide. I have the plans. I have many options to execute myself. But I don't do it. I don't deserve to. Death is too damn easy for someone like me. Too lenient of a punishment for someone who's hurt others so much. I don't deserve the release of death. I respect the conviction of those who die because they simply choose to do, out of  a desire to cease living. But for me, because of how much I've hurt others, I cannot afford myself that luxury to choose. I must remain and suffer. It is only just. I don't know if this is a good reason to not off myself. But it's been keeping me going for now. I honestly don't know what I hoped to accomplish in this post. I was just scrolling through reddit while ideating as usual and thought to visit this sub. I resonated with what I read. I marveled at the complexity and diversity of suicidal thoughts. I guess I wanted to contribute to the conversation is all. I'm not really expecting advice. I've grown doubtful of others' advice to my struggles. Not for a lack of understanding on their part but for my inability to accurately articulate my situation.

The simplest ways to help a friend who is struggling are often the most forgotten. A lot of people's first intuition when trying to help a friend who is struggling and thinking about suicide is to find a solution to the problem, to fix it. Telling a friend to see a specialist, a psychiatrist, and helping him do so is actually helpful, there is no denying any of this, but before over analyzing the situation remember that there are two things that can go a very, very long way, and help a lot more than you may think:. \- hugs. Yes, actual hugs. Ask a guy when's the last time he's been hugged. I bet he can't remember. And girls, who says no to giving a hug to a girl. \- support. Not questions, not advice, but support. The urge to find a solution often makes us forget about the most basic things. thanks for coming to my ted talk

Is life actually worth living anymore?. We've been in this pandemic for a year now and very little, if anything, seems to have improved. I don't know if I can take it anymore, or if I want to spend the rest of my life taking a mental beating from constant restrictions and lockdowns. We have waited a year. We have vaccines but the government can't distribute them fast enough in my country. Now we have another outbreak which appears to be getting out of hand. I've already been through two lockdowns, and I fear this new outbreak will just spread across the country and nullify all of its supposed achievements. What happens if my country just goes back into recession, I become unemployed again and I am just back in the same position I was when this all started, all while under constant pressure from university?. COVID-19 is starting to test the limits of my resilience. I fear that I will never see the world because I'm not allowed to leave my country, and the virus just keeps spreading despite the vaccine. Do I really deserve to live in this excruciatingly oppressive, boring and dystopian world. Surely, suicide is appropriate now?. I refuse to spend the rest of my life like this. I don't want to live in this collapsing world and I want out. I don't see what there is to live for. As far as I can see, the virus has won. Why even bother at this rate? How can people justify living like this? We've been patient, we have persevered we have sacrificed so much and it has all been for nothing. Surely, I can just call it quits now?. Death seems a better option to me than living in this world. I don't even feel alive; I just feel like I am ‚Äòexisting'. I can hardly function anymore. I can barely sleep without waking up in the middle of the night for no obvious reason. I think it's time for me to accept defeat.

It Never Quite Goes Away. I stick around for other people, but not because I want to be alive. It's not just that I don't see a future for myself, I just don't really want one either. It does get better, and then it gets worse, and then it gets better, and then worse, etc. I'm tired of buying time from myself over and over again. I'm tired of fighting to heal when the only reason I'm trying is to make it easier to keep putting myself through life so I don't hurt my loved ones. But honestly? Sometimes I just don't care about them anymore. Maybe that's shitty. Maybe it's that 'indifference toward other people' that they were talking about when I got diagnosed with PTSD (still reeling from that one, it never seemed bad enough to me. Turns out not everyone lives in constant fear and pain and various states of dissociation). I just don't care. I pour so much love and so much time and energy into caring and then it goes away and I'm left alone with the same familiar will to die. I'm not in immediate danger. If I do it, it'll be at least a few months out. I've made enough plans to look forward to that I've bought that much time, at least. I just know that if I do attempt again, I'm not going to fail. And in the meantime, I guess I'm still trying. I'm always trying.

I've made an exit bag. It's also the first time committing suicide has actually really scared me as an idea. I guess I'll just be 100% honest. At 15, I took 120 extra strength aspirin pills. WebMD said it could lead to death. Sounded good enough to me. I remember being yelled at, being slapped, not being able to hear, not being able to stand, and the hospital visit after. At 21, I purchased a gun. It was my first time working with one. I did plenty of research and found where to aim it on my head to ensure I wouldn't be one of the "lucky few" to survive a shot to the head. The pain scared me, and even after I chambered my round, I didn't realize the slide wasn't all the way forward. It was off by maybe half an inch, so when I pulled the trigger, nothing happened. The idea of the pain nerved me out so bad that I couldn't go through with pulling the trigger again after I realized my mistake. People were looking for me and knew that I was a danger to myself, and eventually events led me to hospitalization. Just recently, I purchased rope. Strong enough to hold my weight, but I didn't think it'd need to. I read up on partial suspension hanging and thought I had the noose positioning right and everything. I got into a remote location and went with the plan. But, no matter how tight it was or how much I leaned into it, all I felt was the pain and pressure in my head with no sign of passing out coming about. I gave up, my face purple and blotched from the bleeding of every single blood vessel in my face. I knew a full hanging was too much pain for me to take. Today, I have an exit bag set up. I've done it perfectly, and felt absolutely nothing while preparing it just in the same way as I have for a while now in any situation in life. My lifelong depression evolved into depersonalization over the last year, and it's left me feeling so much less of everything. So empty. When I turned that gas valve, though, I panicked. It shot out so much louder next to my ear than I anticipated. I know it won't hurt, or it's not supposed to, but my chest hurt anyways. I turned off the gas and just sat in shock. I don't really know how to feel at this point. I know that this method is surefire if done right (and I've done it right) but realizing the fact that there's nobody in my life anymore who I can even write some god awful angsty suicide note to hurts a little bit. Realizing that this is really it, absolutely for real something that fits within my fears and means feels so odd. I've fought with this for a long time and felt despair over my desire to die until I became numb to everything. Now I have it and I feel somewhere between lonely and anxious. I'm not sure what I'm asking for if anything here, but I'm scared of it failing and scared of dying at the same time. I'm sad that for the last while I've made decisions and actions that unintentionally or intentionally pushed the few people in my life away from me. I feel very alone and exhausted.

Don't see a future where my life becomes worthwhile. I'm a garbage person who should just end my life for my benefit and the benefit of those around me. I'm just a leech who will never accomplish anything.

First time I ever consider suicide Sorry for the long post.       I never considered suicide until last year, but I don't think I can go on much longer.        I'm from Lebanon, a small country in the Middle East. You may have heard about it in the news. This country that had an extraordinarily rich culture, perfect geography, and infinite potential, has turned to a literal hell hole in the span of a year and a half. And the worst is yet to come.           In 2019 I was 22, freshly graduated, and had my first job. I had moved out and started living independently, life was fucking great but I didn't realize it back then. I'll spare you the political and economical details unless someone is interested, but in October everything started turning to shit. The effects of decades of widespread corruption and sectarian division started to show, and the economy started going downhill.        I lost my job in January of 2020, along with a huge chunk of the population. I had to start financially relying on my parents again, which already took away what I enjoyed the most in my life: the fact I was finally a self-sufficient, responsible person. Then covid hit. And then on August 4th 2020, what some of you may know Lebanon for, happened.       The third biggest non-nuclear explosion in the history of mankind happened in the heart of Beirut, the capital. It created a shockwave that was felt all the way to Cyprus, a fucking ISLAND 200 kilometers away from Lebanon. Why? Because the government was so corrupt and negligent that thousands of tons of explosive chemicals were dangerously stored in a warehouse and caught fire.      Thankfully my family and I lived far enough from the explosion to suffer nothing but shattered windows, but I was a few hundred meters away from the blast when it happened. You can find footage of the explosion online, so I don't think I have to go in detail as to what happened. I knew my family were home so I didn't worry about them, but my grandpa lived even closer to the blast than I was, and phones were unusable. I started running towards his home, as I anticipated seeing him crushed by rubble.      The thought of describing what I saw that day, running through the city where I made my strongest friendships, found love, studied, graduated, and got into the professional world, already has me shaking and crying.     Entire houses and buildings I knew had turned into rubble. The road was a sea of glass, stone, and cement. Sirens, people shouting, screaming, crying, everywhere. I don't even want to think about how many dead people I ran by. I don't think anyone can even make a movie like this. I think I'm gonna stop talking about this.     Thankfully my grandpa only suffered minor injuries. I'm glad I wasn't the one to take him to the hospital because I don't think I could have taken it. I've heard stories and seen videos of destroyed hospitals, that were already crowded with covid cases, walls and floors covered in blood and doctors performing surgeries on the floor.       This was the last straw for Lebanon. In 2019, 1$ was equivalent to 1500 Lebanese pounds. Today, it's 13800, and increasing by the day. Medicine, fuel, electricity, and food are becoming less and less accessible. People are fighting in supermarkets over bread or milk for their kids. Lebanon is the poorest, hungriest, and most politically unstable it has ever been. Robberies and violence are becoming routine. We're headed to a collapse that will be remembered in history books as a case study of how corrupt, evil, greedy, and hateful humans can get.     And then there's me. I've spent the last few months alone in my appartment because of lockdowns and the financial crisis, with no job, no foreign passport or any other way to get out of this hell hole, and nothing to do except watching netflix or playing video games when the electricity and internet connection allow it. I roll a joint the second I wake up because I don't think I can face this life sober for a single hour.       Millions of people around the world go through poverty, traumas and wars, but what kills me from the inside is remembering the life I had, and could have had. I was a regular kid from a regular family, had friends, went to school, and was about to live a normal life. Now I understand how valuable this is. Many of my friends managed to leave or had already left to study abroad before the crisis. The others I barely see anymore. I can't imagine what my parents are going through, raising me for all these years just for me to have my life taken away from me like that.  I have no one to open up to, which is why I'm writing on a new account.       Now I can't do anything other than being a spectator of my own existence and watch hell break loose from my window, holding on to the memory of the two decades of "normal life" I had. I guess I'll just continue to exist until I find the courage to get this over with, or until some other mega bomb goes off next to my home.       I beg you to enjoy every friend, family member, pet, every meal in a restaurant, every roadtrip, every party,  every exam, hour spent at work, every laughter, every argument, every fight, every kiss, and every drink as if they were the last you will ever have, because they might very well be.

He didnt care but i started worrying that a bat bit his nose while he was sleeping (we never saw a bat in our lives) and i found a sticky gum like thing thats white. Its really big and i stepped on it a couple times it feels like gum. So i convinced myself that it was saliva of a rabid animal who flew in. He didn‚Äôt worry at all. I later told him about my fears. He started panicking. I panicked too. I didnt really give a shit wether or not i had rabies because im going to kill myself soon but i REALLY didn‚Äôt want him to get rabies. Im just stuck Okay, Im really not the type to post this sort of stuff but I guess I just have to get it off my chest. I'm a 23M, and father of 2 girls. I'm from Aus, so there is alot of mental health support and I've seen multiple people. I'm about to see another phsyciatrist in a couple days to more properly diagnose what I'm going through and hopefully get me on the right medication. Now, what I'm trying to get to is, I'm not bothered anymore. I'm not bothered seeing anyone anymore, I'm not bothered trying to distract myself anymore, I'm not bothered trying to get better anymore. I have been going through depression for the last 5 years or so (I know it isn't long, but for me it's felt like my whole life). I feel like I'm ready to go, I feel like I'm not scared of death, if anything I feel like I embrace it. I want to end this pain that I go through every single day, but I can't. I can't bear to think that my two daughters will grow up without a dad, I can't bear to think that my partner won't have anyone to help with the kids, I can't bear to think that my widowed mum will be by herself. But it pisses me off soo much that I can't leave this terrible place because of them. I'm stuck here. I'm stuck living a life that I don't want to live. I just want to know what to do!! Everyone says just keep trying, it will get better, but it doesn't. And if it will, I can't wait anymore. I cant deal with this anymore. But I have to do. Even though everyday that I wake up I just feel closer and closer to suicide. I don't find joy in anything, everything I loved I no longer enjoy, going to beach houses, holidays, movies anything that a normal person would enjoy, I don't. I literally don't find joy in anything anymore. Well that's my rant done. Sorry for bothering anyone.

I honestly can‚Äôt imagine liking my appearance (long vent) I never liked myself or thought I was pretty even when I was little. Back then I was mostly just indifferent to the way I looked, like I didn‚Äôt hate my appearance but I definitely didn‚Äôt love it. I do remember hating all my school pictures, and whenever I had to see my most recent one I‚Äôd look away because I disliked looking at myself. This was back when I was in about third grade I think.  Looking back, I don‚Äôt think I was pretty as a kid despite when people say. My family thinks I was a gorgeous baby and kid, but I really don‚Äôt see it. When I was in fifth grade there was a slideshow of all the kids in the grades‚Äô baby, kindgarten and current pictures at elementary school graduation, and I remember wincing when mine can up. I was ashamed that everyone had to see me as an ugly little kid.  As I‚Äôm writing this I realize how awful it sounds. Maybe there‚Äôs just no such thing as a good picture of me, but either way I‚Äôm not made for photos. Even when I was little I wasn‚Äôt.  I really don‚Äôt know how other people can look at themselves in the mirror and not hate what they see. I‚Äôm happy they all don‚Äôt have to go through what I do. Saying this makes me feel incredibly awful, because I‚Äôm not covered in scars (on my face or other easily visible body parts at least) and don‚Äôt have any disfigurements or anything. I just hate my skin, my face, my everything.  Everyday when I wake up and look in the mirror I can‚Äôt help but think about how unattractive I am. I constantly think about how no one would ever want me and how I‚Äôll never date anyone for several reasons, one of them being how much I dislike myself and my appearance. I think I‚Äôd be unfair to a potential boyfriend to have to date someone who hates themselves as much as I do, and that‚Äôs assuming someone would actually like me.  Two boys have liked me in the past, one in ninth grade and one a few weeks ago at a psych hospital. The one from ninth grade told me he liked me but not just because I was pretty, but for other reasons I forgot about. He was overall scary and extremely manipulative, so I took that with a grain of salt. The psych hospital guy was really nice and when I mentioned how unattractive I thought I was, he said that all the boys in the room would disagree. He ended up being manipulative as well and was scary too, and I‚Äôm never seeing him again anyways so I disregarded that statement.  I just don‚Äôt believe it when people call me pretty. I know that when you like a person they look more attractive to you and when you dislike someone they look uglier to you, so when my friends say how pretty I am I just remember that and think that must be the reason. Or they‚Äôre just being nice.  I know I‚Äôll never date anyone for a lot of reasons, like because I‚Äôm scared of boys/men, hate myself and how I look, have trauma, and am asexual and afraid of sex in general. I don‚Äôt think anyone would want me.  Sorry for being a bummer yet again, I just don‚Äôt know where else I could vent about this. I feel so incredibly bad about myself every day and wanted to get this out.

Kinda amazed I'm still around honestly. I'm 27, going to turn 28 in a few months. I've been depressed for as long as I can remember. When I was in elementary school I used to constantly wish I had never been born. I was convinced I'd kill myself by the time I was 16. Obviously, that didn't happen.  I've had ups and downs in my life, I had a period of maybe two years in college where I actually genuinely felt GOOD about my life and where it was headed. Then my depression and anxiety got worse again. Spent a week in a behavioral hospital. Got on meds. They took the edge off but I never got back to that positive space. I wasn't miserable though, so they did their job.  Fast forward to last year, my dad killed himself in February. It came out of nowhere. Not gonna get deep into it, but we never had a great relationship until we reconnected around 2018. It pretty much wrecked me. I'm still not "over it." I can't even handle thinking about him.  Literally the only reason I haven't killed myself is because of my mom. She has no other family and it would destroy her if I died, especially in that way. I will not do that to her. But, as it stands right now, I'm going to kill myself when she's gone. I've never admitted that to anyone but I need to get it off my chest.  I keep hoping that something will happen to make me want to stick around. That I'll find passion for something, get a good job, maybe a partner. You know, the usual things. But it's hard to even muster up the energy to do simple things like get out of bed and shower. It's also just. . . hard to plan for the future when you've spent your whole life thinking, "I'm going to kill myself one day."  Honestly I'm kinda just posting this to get it off my chest. I don't really delve too deeply into how shitty I feel with my mom or my friends because I don't want to burden them. They've all got their own mental illnesses to deal with and I don't want to add my own baggage.

I talk about suicide quite a bit but let me flip the script for a second here. I'm super fucking thankful all humans end up in the same place; six feet under. I like to call it the Great Neutralizer. The ultimate Stabilizer. Never forget it, were all intrinsically equal here on Earth. This is the proof. This is what I point to when I prove we are all equal. Never believe the idea you are less than any other. To prove it, you will die. They will die. Here is where you will both rest. Despite what any other human says. You will die, like them.          To me, I find this uplifting. As dark as it appears to be, I find it refreshing. Gives me good reason to not believe that yearly salary is what makes a man "valuable". Don't confuse societal standards for intrinsic worth. You're every bit as human as anyone else. Now go live before you all die.

(TW) Suicide is sometimes rational, and I'm trying to honestly figure out if that's where I'm at I'm 22, I've been homeless and fleeing domestic violence for most of my adult life with severe chronic PTSD, eating disorders that I'm statistically pretty likely to die from before 30 and depressive-psychotic episodes which often come at the worst times and put me in increased danger or can cause me to (accidentally) hurt anyone who cared enough to stick around. I wake up most days at 4 am re-experiencing rape, and my day usually gets worse from there on out. I've tried EVERY treatment I could access, from years of hospitalizations (10+, mostly voluntary and ALL of them made it much worse) and way more medication than any person should take, to off the books treatments and therapists, psycho-analysis, massage, acupuncture and Chinese herbs, other herbs, self-medicating with fun herbs, seeing dieticians and nutritionists and holistic life couches, DBT, CBT, ACT, EMDR, all kinds of groups and programs, live-in programs, eating disorder residentials, endless outpatient clinics, case management, peer support, even psychedelic therapy, getting an emotional support animal, skydiving, learning to play the harp, traveling the continent multiple times and trying to create my own hospital alternatives.  I've literally done everything I have the power to do to try and recover inside and outside of the system, and most of these things haven't made a considerable difference or have actually made it actively worse (meds lol). No matter the case, I don't have the resources to keep trying and I just don't have the energy anymore either.    My life ending early is likely to be unavoidable anyway, and continuing to live this miserably when I know it's likely for nothing (that I'll never get to recover, feel lasting happiness or maintain healthy relationships), feels cruel to me, especially when I can't stay alive without re-experiencing severe trauma near-daily and putting myself at real risk to repeat that trauma regularly. I've come to think of myself as someone who might be granted ethical assisted suicide if that existed in this country for mental health concerns, despite my age.      So, I'm here writing this mostly, simply, because I don't have any person in my life I can tell this to (except, actually, my mom, who agrees with me and supports my decision to end my life). But I want to know if other people agree this is reasonable or not. It wouldn't necessarily change my mind, but I am trying to do the most rational thing and at this moment my mind is still kind of open.  If you actually took the time to read all of this, bless your soul. If you're here to troll me, idk what else I was expecting i guess

I'd choose the blue pill In this case, I deem the blue pill as living the lie. To be more specific, the dilemma this is about is wether or not you would choose to live in a simulated reality or not, if you know for a fact your life would be better there.  I have modified it a bit, if you could press a buttom to relive only great the moments of your life maybe even make some edits to make those moments better and forget the bad ones, and then die, believing this to be real and being truly content, never realising that you're a) about to die b) that all of it was a lie. Why would you ever not press it? It truly seems like the perfect answer to all of life's suffering.  I've considered looking into self-delusion as a means of achieving something similar. I've often tried to convince myself when attempting to end my life that whatever bad happened wasn't real and "create my own reality" so to speak, so that I could die content. Never quite worked out, probably is practically impossible :/

i half attempted. the other day i argued with my mom a ton. she said that i was lazy and wasnt trying in school. i am. i could feel the dissapointment dripping from every word she said. when she left my room i was a wreck, sobbing my eyes out on my bed. i saw a container of advil on my desk and picked it up. there were roughly 16 pills in it. i rea;lly, really wanted to take them. but i was scared. i was scared of dying. but i couldnt just put them down either. so i took 8 instead, hoping that it would leave it to the universe to decide if i died or not. i did not, barely felt anything. just some mild diziness and blurred vision. i definately want to try again, but there is a single thing keeping me alive. i have a trip to see my grandparents planned in july. its one of the only things in the future i can actually look forward to. but every day of living is so excruciatingly difficult i dont know how much longer i can last, and how many more close calls i can have. im scared. dying is scary. but i want to at the same time. the inner child in me comes out whenever im holding a bottle of pills or a razor, the kid that is just afraid to be hurt. afraid to die.

Tells me I'm ungrateful when I go to her for help. The worst part of this is that I'm fed up with all of it. And she now took the only thing keeping me here from me. She keeps taking my phone from me every night (I am typing this from my laptop). Usually, if I have problems like this, I go on there and talk to a friend that can help. But now I have to go on here just to live through possibly another terrible day. I don't know how much more I can take. I'm treated terribly and the moment I do or say anything about it, she gets mad at me. My siblings pretty much do whatever they want. My brother, growing up, was allowed to fight me, to threaten to harm me, and pretty much anything else. My sister is allowed to do the same stuff. Because "they're younger than you" or some shit. But the moment I tell her that I'm sick of this bullshit, I'm the next Ted Bundy. They literally hate me. All of them. I can't have a break for once. And her boyfriend is in on it, too. My mum asks me why I don't eat. Asks if I have an eating disorder (I've already told her no, but she still insists because I'm skinny). Her boyfriend comes to me in the middle of supper when I still haven't finished to ask me why I'm not eating. And I know it's the same bullshit reason she does it. He's so rude to me and every time I say something about it, my mum tells him that he isn't wrong and tells me that I'm being disrespectful. Even though I'm getting disrespected right in front of her. She knows that I want to die. She doesn't care. The last time I went to her for help, she yelled at me. And then told me that this was my fault because i haven't been praying enough. She knows I need help, but she refuses to help me. She's literally killing me. I don't know how long I can stay like this. I also have misophonia and they think it's funny to purposely trigger it. They'll even laugh. My mum made me cry a few days ago doing that. I've been living this way for years and it still hasn't gotten any better. It's only gotten worse. I don't want to be alive anymore. I can't handle it. All of this is too much and there's much more that I'd rather not say because of how long this is. I don't know how much longer I can go on like this. I don't think I can hang on for much longer.

If you're thinking of suicide... Seriously think about it. Don't do it because you're sad or depressed. Take your emotions and others opinions and thoughts out of the equation. Take a good, long look at your life. At life itself. Match up how you fit into all of it, and seriously do a lot of reflection and conclusive analysis on your life. Take a truthful look at your life and be brutally honest with yourself about whether or not it's something that is working for you. Is it worth it to continue living? Have you done everything you could to try and create the type of life you want? What is the likelihood of your life changing for the better? What is the likelihood of life, itself, changing for the better? Really sit and ponder things like that. I'm amazed at the clarity that comes from doing this. So, please think deeply about it. Because, the right choice for you will come from within. And listen to the choice made, because that will be the right choice.

[Academic] Research into Suicide within the LGBTQ+ Community Social Awareness Project Survey (all welcome) Hello all! Below is a link to a survey created for my class's Social Awareness Project. It's a short and sweet, 8-question survey based around suicide in the LGBTQ+ community that takes less than a minute to complete. I ask that anyone who is willing to, please take this survey. It is primarily geared towards those within the LGBTQ+ community, but anyone may take it. The results will go a long way in the data collection for the project and with spreading awareness of suicide within our community.  Due to the sensitive nature of the subject matter, please feel free to stop the survey at any time, or to just simply not do it as well.   All results are completely anonymous.  Please do not hesitate to reach out to me if you wish to discuss the subject at hand, any of the questions, or if you need any help with the survey.  Help is always available 24/7 to anyone in suicidal crisis or emotional distress at 1-800-273-8255.

equal parts bitter rant/unsent letter. today is November 3rd. the day that for many reasons, i had planned on for my suicide.   this decision was made 3 months ago to the date. on September 3rd.  i was in an incredible amount of pain & needed a plan.   i decided that I‚Äôd find time to go to the beach. then return to my mother‚Äôs home where I‚Äôd do it.   there was pain. at that time.  over time the pain changed into vague apathy & a general dissociation from this existence.   early September was also the time i went into a deep isolation. stopped talking to everyone. in an attempt to protect myself.   i don‚Äôt really have anything to say. if i cared more, i would articulate all the ways i felt aggrieved. & maybe demand some kind of ramifications but. that doesn‚Äôt matter.  i‚Äôm not looking for sympathy. no one owes me anything.   i think that i want to communicate that there isn‚Äôt going to be a ‚Äúbetter‚Äù me. there‚Äôs some hopes that maybe if i go to therapy. something.   sometime in September i wrote, ‚Äòsomething inside me has died‚Äô & it isn‚Äôt coming back.   there‚Äôs nothing i am willing to work towards/to fix.   i am just patiently waiting for my next November 3rd.   i won‚Äôt set a date. so i feel flexible enough.  but i know it‚Äôs coming. i do not plan to live any longer than i already have - only to experience more pain.   i am wildly miserable now & i just cannot imagine things getting worse. & yet i know they will.   i am building up to the day that i will finally have the courage that sneakily eluded me today.

i was robbed of what was supposed to be my best years and i want to die because of it i learned from a young age not to trust people. since i was 9 i kept a strong guard up and have never let anyone get close to me. i stopped hanging out with friends outside of school once i entered high school, and even before then i rarely did it. if friends did happen to invite me out, i would cancel last minute out of fear of who knows what. now i'm a junior in high school and i have maybe 2 real friends and 5 or so ones i think just put up with me. none of them have asked me to hang out in the 3 years ive known them until last week. tonight was prom and i did not go because i hate my body and despise being seen in public. i cant remember most of my life before this point. i spent 6th-10th grade wishing i could die and purposely developing bad habits in hopes of killing myself "on accident." ive always wanted to learn an instrument but never did because i hated myself too much. i've sabotaged my own life and i had no clue. i was a fucking loser who just watched anime all day throughout elementary and middle school. i quit all my sports by the time i was 12. i thought escaping into fantasy would solve my problems but instead it just fucked up my grip on reality even more. my parents didnt see these as issues i needed help with, but rather things to scold me for. i wasn't listened to when i brought up my suicidal thoughts at 11 and i've been suffering alone ever since. now my mom is dead and im stuck with a dad who i think is disappointed in me. my grades were excellent before but now theyre only just above average because the stress of real life got to me. i watched my mom die of cancer for 3 years, how was i meant to function? i had put all my skills on hold because i stopped caring and only wanted to die. i never finish art anymore. im trying to work on music but i hate everything i do. i've done everything wrong and i had no fucking clue because i was a child. now im just a weirdo and i don't think any of my friends actually like me. i just don't do anything anymore. all i have the energy to do is lay in bed and watch youtube videos and occasionally play guitar before i start to hate myself. what i hate most is everyone thinks i've wasted this time because i'm lazy when in reality i have severe problems that nobody who was supposed to care about me has ever acknowledged. i don't see why i shouldn't end it all.

Actively Suicidal Despite All Treatments I've had every single treatment under the sun.  I'm on SSRIs and two mood stabilizers. I've done CBT, DBT and traditional talk therapy. I don't drink or use anymore. I've got all the 'skills' and frameworks.   None of it helps.   I'm still suicidal every couple of days. I'm still making plans and figuring out my means. I'm still trying to figure out how to get my hands on a firearm, and if I can't do that, a noose or enough gasoline for self-immolation.      The sad truth is that when the cause of the pain is external (other people and their abusive or evil behavior) rather than internal (self-loathing), no amount of therapy is going to help. When your life is constantly under threat, when every day you are getting attacked or threatened with violence, sooner or later you just break.

Having no escape So before anyone says, no, I simply don't have any options. I was talking on the phone to my therapist about it and she felt baffled because I don't actually have options, I can't file for disability and the money would get stolen from me anyways, I can't go homeless, I can't rely on other family members, I have no friends, there are no programs that would accept me because i'm 19, so i'm too old for youth stuff unfortunately, i'm not in school, don't have a license, ID, my birth certificate. With all this being said I think it's time to end it, some people don't get the luck of the draw which I accept. I just wish life wasn't as unfair to people as it has been to me.

Fantasy I‚Äôve had this very specific fantasy for quite awhile now, even before my life was shit honestly, but lately I find myself imagining it and yearning for it more and more:   I have a very average day. Nothing really happens, good or bad. The most forgettable day possible. In the late afternoon I get in my car and just pick a direction and drive. It might be deep into a desert, or far into a forest, or up to the top of a mountain. Just somewhere far away from all other people, away from lights and sounds and ‚Äúthe world.‚Äù I roll to a stop at some point, I don‚Äôt even really notice that I‚Äôve done it but I‚Äôm just there alone wherever I‚Äôve gone. The windows are rolled down and I can hear the quietness all around. I just sit and escape into that subtle nothing for awhile. And as the sun goes below the horizon just before it gets too dark, I put on a specific playlist I‚Äôve made (I have it and listen to it a lot when I fantasize). I put a needle in my arm and give myself enough opiate to never wake up and I drift away right there and then. Not because I‚Äôm hurt, or sad, or angry.  Just because I want to.

I will always have this fucking horrifying trauma, I will always be mentally ill, I can't take care of myself or get out of bed, I can't get anywhere in life.

What‚Äôs the point? What‚Äôs the point in this life I ‚Äúlive‚Äù?  What‚Äôs the point in trying? Why do I still grudgingly get out of bed everyday? Why do I take another breath? Who actually cares? I‚Äôm never good enough, I‚Äôm never enough in general. I‚Äôll always be an after thought. I Just want to Die My name is Adam and i have been suicidal for as long as i can remember. I also just found out that I don't have a job anymore I was layed off for the winter and supposed to start again soon now I just found out they don't want me back so seems like just another reason to do it, when nothing good ever happens for you and it is just shit on shit on shit why keep going. I cannot stand the "I know things are hard now, but chin up, things will get better !" sentiment. For fuck's sake. Things just don't "get better", life circumstances don't just change. You have to make them, and if you can't you're fucked. Lots of people are fucked, with their back against a wall and no way out of dire situations. Either you can cope and use the tools available to change your life, or you can't. If you can't change things, you can choose to suffer or give up. A lot of people who suffer choose to suffer because they have faith that if they are patient and good the universe will reward them. The universe rewards no one, it's an indifferent system. People are only willing to suffer and sacrifice everyday if they meaningfully believe it would lead to a fulfilling, happy outcome. Once it becomes clear that this will not be the case, people become either give up or become delusional.

Is therapy worth it/How to find a therapist? Hi. I'm feeling a little nervous about posting here as I don't want anyone in my real life to find out but I thought this would be a good resource for me. If this post shouldn't go here let me know and I'll take it down.   I'm a first time mom to a 9 month old boy. I've had issues with depression and anxiety since middle school but I've always been able to manage it ok. A few years ago I started taking birth control pills to regulate my hormones which really helped my mental health a lot, so when I got married I just stayed on the pill for preventing pregnancy as well. It clearly didn't work for me, as I now have a 9 month old baby. Since giving birth I've struggled with PPD and PPA, and I needed to start taking some form of birth control again to prevent another pregnancy, but the pill messes with breastfeeding and failed last time so I couldn't do that and got the arm implant instead. I don't know if my current issues have to do with the new implant or just PPD/PPA or just because I haven't been able to take the pill anymore or what, but it's getting bad.   My mental health has declined so much in the last 9 months I feel like I'm not even the same person. It's getting constantly worse and worse every day to the point where I have saved and hidden the bottle of oxycontin they gave me after giving birth (they gave it to me due to complications I won't go into rn), in case I want to take them all at once and end it. I've taken them out of the bottle and just held them in my hand a few times, but I was too weak to go through with it. I know I have enough of them to kill me. I know my husband and son would be better off without me. My son is so young, he wouldn't remember me so he wouldn't truly feel the loss later in life. My husband is young (we're early 20s) and a wonderful man so he could easily find someone else, someone better. I'm toxic and treat him badly. I know he walks on eggshells, the smallest thing can set me off and I have these extreme mood swings, I feel like a crazy person but I can't stop. I completely break down all the time for literally any reason or sometimes no reason. I hate myself. I'm angry and frustrated constantly but I can't show it to my son, I have to make myself smile and play with him and meet his emotional needs, so then I have no energy left for my husband. I'm completely emotionally drained. At the end of every day at I just lay in bed exhausted but unable to sleep, wishing I was dead. I don't want to feel like this anymore, I don't want to feel anything. When I think about death it feels like peace, it gives me comfort. I just want to lay down and sleep and never wake up.   My husband has tried so hard to support me, he took over most of the household chores and is an equal parent when we're both home. I told him I was really struggling and even having some suicidal thoughts but I downplayed it. He begs me to see a therapist but he's scared to push me on it. He tells me all the time he appreciates me, and that he and my son need me. It just makes me feel worse. I've treated my husband so badly and he still is so gentle and caring. He deserves so much better and he'll never leave me and I can't leave him, I cant do this without him, so I should just make the choice for him and he'll be forced to move on and find someone better. He wants me to see a therapist so bad, he's scared and I hate seeing him like this i wish I just hadn't told him. I just can't do this I can't call anyone I can't ask for help I don't want to sit in a room and have someone tell me how shitty I am, I know how shitty I am and I don't need a therapist to tell me about it. what are they going to tell me that I don't already know? How do you even go about finding a therapist? I asked my doctor a couple years ago and she said I have to look into all the therapists in my area and find one that takes my insurance. That feels like an insurmountable hill. Not to mention that even if I find one I might not click with them and I've heard you have to meet several therapists before you find the right one for you I just would rather end it and have this all be over. I don't know what to say to my husband. I have to take my son in for his 9 month checkup in 6 days and they're going to make me fill out that fucking mental health form and I don't know what to do. I dont want to lie, I HATE lying with every fiber of my being, but if I fill it out accurately it'll set off the red flags and they'll have to ask me a bunch of questions and what if they decide I'm not fit to parent because I might kill myselfand  what if they take my son away? What if they call CPS and they try to take him away from me? I would rather die than lose my son. I don't know what to do and I know rhis post is too long and I'm so sorry about that I just don't have anyone to talk to and I don't know what to do and I feel like killing myself is the only option that makes sense.

I really just want to die I‚Äôve felt this way since I was 14, I‚Äôm 18 now. I had toxic friends who told me I couldn‚Äôt be depressed because my life is too good and it wasn‚Äôt possible, they berated me when I started isolating myself, telling me they were scared of me and that I was being a bitch. My dad has always been emotionally manipulative and mentally abusive, I was terrified of being left on my own with him until age 12, he made me feel like I wasn‚Äôt worth anything unless I was good at school, which I wasn‚Äôt. I barely passed my GCSEs, I dropped out of A levels when we (the uk) went into the first lockdown because my head of sixth form told me I was just going to fail anyways. I‚Äôve had a string of toxic relationships, been sexually abused a few times. I made really good friendships in the last year but in a matter of weeks I lost all of them and now they all hate me (it was my fault, I made a mistake and I fucked up, I deserved it). I feel so alone and so fucking numb, most days I can‚Äôt get out of bed. I used to get so passionate about things, I used to love so so strongly, but now the only thing I really feel is despair. It‚Äôs like death has a rope tied around me and it‚Äôs slowly dragging me away from everything. I wouldn‚Äôt even care if it just pulled a bit fucking quicker. I‚Äôm not scared of death at all, I haven‚Äôt been for years; I tried to kill myself back in May, I really thought I was going to die and I wasn‚Äôt scared at all, I was relieved that I would finally be able to rest properly. Since then it‚Äôs just gotten worse and all I can think about is how beautiful it would be just to suddenly cease to exist, to finally be at peace. The only reason I haven‚Äôt is because I feel so selfish leaving my mum on her own, she loves me so much and I love her, I just wish she could understand how much pain I‚Äôm in all the time and how difficult it is just to be alive. Actually fuck that, I‚Äôm not alive, I haven‚Äôt been alive for months, I‚Äôm just existing in a world that didn‚Äôt anticipate me surviving this long. Living isn‚Äôt lying in bed crying your eyes out every night. Living isn‚Äôt smiling to everyone and doing such a good job of convincing them you‚Äôre okay after years of practice. Living isn‚Äôt getting up and going about my day in a trance, feeling so numb it‚Äôs as if I‚Äôm watching someone else live my life for me while I crouch in the corner of my mind, shivering and sobbing. The worst part is that I don‚Äôt want to live. I don‚Äôt want to be happy because it makes it so much worse when you go back down again, I don‚Äôt want to be happy because that means having people around and all I‚Äôll do is hurt them. I just wish there was a way to stop existing and make everyone forget I ever existed in the first place. I don‚Äôt want people to mourn for me because I want to die to stop hurting them. I wish people could see how much pain I‚Äôm in and how exhausted I am so that maybe they could understand even slightly why I felt I had to do it. I wish people could just be happy that I‚Äôd be at peace for the first time in so long. I just really really want to die.

With Their empty eyes, my soul condemn,    best at creeping upon us - skilled hiders.      Might be deeply terrified,    I just don't see a treasure full of insects to be worth the try.   Maybe your hazard seems justified,    but I'm just tired of getting attached only to get in bed and cry.      Every time I think of an infatuation,   I can feel spiders crawling from my esophagus down my tummy,   try to bend and wreck the pure and precious into a new creation,    devour the butterflies just because they looked so yummy.      Now that the fragile can no longer fly and feel,    the jewels - hidden under webs and corpses,    everything just feels surreal,    maybe it's just my fault cuz all I do is obsess.     Do you get it?    I yearn to stop.   I keep getting bit.    Every emotion is a hit.      I'm so down and beaten up.    I feel the venom in my veins.    I think I can pour my thoughts into a cup,    but no one's gonna want to drink my brains.     The taste, I imagine, is gonna be so bitter,    no particular smell,    just the essence of a quitter.   I think the only place I belong to is hell.      I just feel out of control.    I thought I hit rock bottom but alas,    I kept digging down that damned hole,    until I feel disconnected from my mass.      There's no progression ever.    I'm just stuck here.    Rotting in the pit forever,    white noise is all I hear.

My friend committed suicide two weeks ago. Two weeks ago I lost one of my closest friends to suicide. Usually I'm a guy who takes life in a very ordered manner: one hurdle over the next. I don't believe in wallowing in self pity or oversharing on the internet, but sheesh guys this is hard. People go on and on about how you shouldn't feel guilty about not being there, but the truth is that I can't feel anything else. I really do wish that I was in the same room to tell him "NO!". I wish I was there to hug him a last time. I wonder a lot if he thought about me ... was I not enough to make him stay?  I've never quite cried this much in my life and my entire world is collapsing into this burning hell on Earth. Everyday when I get up I can't send a stupid snap, share an unfunny history meme, or wonder about the future loudly. Who am I going to go to swim meets with? Who am I going to talk to to? All of a sudden, life is getting very real. Throughout this senior year, I've maintained a really good GPA and kept up with absolutely everything even through quarantine but honestly, I can't do this anymore. It's hurting me to think that life is going to move on.  I attended his funeral a week ago and listening to the pastor was disgusting. He was saying things like "he chose to leave". I do not believe that my best friend made the active choice to leave - he felt helpless and lonely - those are not the same thing. I will never believe that one thoughtfully considers the choice of killing themself.  I feel thrown off my path. It sucks to say this, but I'm going to have to prioritize my exams this spring over my mental health or anything else. And also, to hell with society about the stigma around mental health. You live in hell and make others walk through hell as well when you say us guys can't speak about our emotions. To hell with this rotten education system that requires 17 and 18 year olds to make choices about their 40 year-old selves.  I'm going to try to end by saying that it's going to kill me just the same when I have to graduate without him, listen to our favourite songs without him or get married and not have him be my best man. I'm getting ripped apart piece-by-piece everyday but I'm going to have to move forward with this pain. I need to hope that it hurts less in the future. I just need to get though my IB exams. I just need to make it to May.  I hope that if you've ever "*considered*" commiting suicide, you're being played by your own brain. Please do your loved ones a favour and go goddamn write, talk, scream your problems. Please. It hurts everyone. It is not worth it.

I hate everything about myself. So I‚Äôm 22, I have a year and a half left of school. I changed programs so all my friends have already graduated. From the outside it looks like I have it all. I‚Äôm a varsity athlete, executive director of three prominent student groups, an honours student, and I‚Äôm one of the supervisors at my job. People look up to me. I‚Äôm a trans rights activist. I‚Äôm a disability advocate. I‚Äôm a hard worker and I look like I persevere through things.   However, I don‚Äôt.   I‚Äôve posted before, my family is shit basically. That situation is still horrible. However in the span of 72 hours I‚Äôve needed to get glued back together in emerge twice, and I haven‚Äôt slept because I‚Äôm laying awake dissociating trying to not kill myself. Nothing feels real. I spend hours laying in one spot thinking about dying.   My friends left me when I became their boss at work, my partner just dumped me because I have too much going on, I‚Äôm broke and my solution to not having money is to be a sugar baby but I feel filthy because I‚Äôve been sexually assaulted and never dealt with the trauma, my ex from several years ago is saying I stabbed him (that never happened, he‚Äôs currently having a psychotic break. he sexually assaulted me and I dumped him. That was it), I was in ANOTHER car accident, and I failed a practical (frisbee, it‚Äôs a blow off course) because I was mourning the death of my friend who got hit by a car cycling in September. My bio mom told me she doesn‚Äôt want anything to do with my, my dad and step mom don‚Äôt want me if I‚Äôm trans (‚Äòyou‚Äôre a monster destroying our daughter‚Äô).   My life has always been hard. I‚Äôve been verbally, physically, and psychologically abused for much of it. I‚Äôve been sexually assaulted four times. I‚Äôm chronically ill with epilepsy, gastroparesis, and a rare blood disorder that has no cure and just destroys my body. My parents denied me access to doctors when I was a kid so my system is completely fucked up. I need surgery to repair some things and I just found that out. I keep pushing through but I‚Äôm so. So. Fucking. Tired. I can‚Äôt push through it anymore. My counsellor wanted to take me to the hospital yesterday but I managed to talk through things because I knew if I went to the hospital I couldn‚Äôt kill myself.   I took too many pills and I‚Äôm still alive. I got a little carried away with self harm and then didn‚Äôt treat it for a good hour hoping things would just end. I can‚Äôt do this anymore. I hate everything about myself. Nothing is good enough. I‚Äôm not good enough. I made a video saying goodbye. This isn‚Äôt my ex partner‚Äôs fault, even though it lines up with me being dumped (time wise). Did it affect things? yes. But it was more of a ‚Äòfinal straw‚Äô situation. I can‚Äôt bring myself to delete the video. I cant bring myself to think of the next 20 minutes let alone the next 24 hours.  My body and mind are a mess. My life is a rollercoaster I can‚Äôt get off of. I have nothing and no one. I already have someone who will take my pets when I die. I wish I could make things work. I‚Äôve tried so hard. But nothing helps. Everything always falls apart. Everything I touch breaks. I wreck everything. It feels like everything is out of my control; so I‚Äôm going to take back that control. I can control my life: whether I live or die. I know that if I die, everything will be better for everyone. Why push forward when there are so many reasons to give up. I just want to go to sleep and never wake up.   These thoughts are all disjointed, none of my sentences flow properly; probably because I can‚Äôt focus and also because I‚Äôm just letting out what pops into my mind. My fingers are flying across the keyboard desperately trying to convey my thoughts in a last ditch attempt to talk things through with myself. No one can save me but myself, and I know that.

How does the afterlife affect your suicidal thoughts? I have suffered from sporadic suicidal thoughts and depression for about a year now. I'm a 22 y/o male living in a Scandinavian country. I don't belong to any particular religion. But I'm very spiritual. And I know for a fact (no matter how much one might try to convince me on the contrary) that if I should die ‚Äì there IS a afterlife. Nothing can change this truth of mine. I've been a firm believer in the hereafter and the spiritual nature of the human soul long before I ever knew was depression or suicidal idiation was.  Knowing life will continue, I would actually rather want to exit this life and move on the next one. But I know I shouldn't. And I also know it will never happen because I could never inflict this much emotional trauma on my poor unsuspecting and kind parents ‚Äì as well as other people in my life.  But still, I want to go back to "God" (or your understanding of the source) and have nothing more to do with this world of darkness, challenges and despair. What should I do? Can anybody relate?  Also, I am afraid I will become a sinner of sorts or a bad person later on in life (even though I'm actually very compassionate) and that scares the crap out of my because I fear I might suffer in the next life. I'm not a Christian though. And when I say "suffer in the next life" I'm not talking about Heaven or Hell. Much less burn in eternal flames. I'm just concerned I won't be rewarded well for my acts and choices in this life if I continue living it and have the opportunity to make choices ‚Äì so I might as well just kill myself right away and go back to the place of love and light from whence I came.  I miss that place soooo much.... and I'm starting to cry now! Oh, I need help!!!

Suicide Survivor: My two cents First of all, I lost almost everyone I loved the most to untimely deaths in recent history. That includes the love of my life who died at 33, my father, several friends and family. I have attempted suicide so many times with full intention to carry it out and I never thought I‚Äôd say I‚Äôm grateful I‚Äôm alive.  I knew that covid would negatively affect people with depression, anxiety and suicidal ideations. I‚Äôve lost loved ones to suicide before, and last April was no exception.   I‚Äôve gone to funeral after funeral after funeral. Life doesn‚Äôt promise us anything except that one day it will be over, so until then why not stick it out?  I want to share a couple things that I hope will help some of you out there. My wish is that whoever is reading this will shed light.   ‚Ä¢ We tend to want to disappear in order to be found. We also can want to disappear from existence because we are tired and the burden gets beyond heavy. You‚Äôre more resilient than you think. There‚Äôs always someone out there you may not have met yet who has an open heart and hand to be there for you. Your life and existence is an unique as a fingerprint. It‚Äôs one thing to relate but be careful when you compare. Life isn‚Äôt a Competition as much as a lot of people make it out to be. Sometimes a lot of want to see if ‚Äúanyone cares‚Äù to find us....I‚Äôm telling you people do. Start with me because I do care about you...and I mean it.  ‚Ä¢ Why was I born? To make a difference for yourself and you have the power even in the smallest of ways to make a difference. I‚Äôve asked myself why the hell I had to be born. ‚ÄúWhy didn‚Äôt my mom abort me?‚Äù Crap like that. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt ask to be born.‚Äù Well, I‚Äôm here. I was given life for ME, and at the end of the day you were given life to allow yourself to enjoy. You can be there for people you care about, but you have to take time to look into what it really means to love yourself. Youtube has a lot of videos on self love. I know it seems like a dumb corny idea, but it‚Äôs worth giving yourself a fighting chance. You were born to go on a quest to experience more than just the lame and depressing situations we can feel stuck in. Reach out.   ‚Ä¢ The simple things in life can be more rewarding than you think. Mindfulness helps a ton. It may seem trivial, but as human beings the mind tends to be geared toward: instant gratification, quick fix, NEXT  Take time to actually taste the food and drink. Take time to focus on your body when you take deep breaths to relax. Meditation is underrated.  ‚Ä¢ Loneliness and longing for connection is normal. Amid this uncertain time, there are several platforms on cool new apps to meet new people. It may seem lame but you never know who you‚Äôre going to meet and connect with. You might actually enjoy yourself.   ‚Ä¢ We tend to have habits of thinking and cycles we revisit. The hardest part of breaking any habit is the beginning. Then it becomes easier and more rewarding, because the fruits of labor are.   ‚Ä¢ Allow yourself to be treated as if you were treating someone you love the most. We tend to negative self talk quite often and I‚Äôm telling you to cut that out immediately. We all have to keep ourselves in check but put down the bat. If you like to do art or sing because you like it even though you may feel like you‚Äôre not ‚Äúgood enough‚Äù, do it! Anyone can make art, and it‚Äôs so much healthier for the brain than people think. Don‚Äôt limit yourself. Don‚Äôt sell yourself short.   ‚Ä¢ Bad memories are part of life unfortunately, but there‚Äôs got to be at least one okay memory you have right? If you‚Äôre saying ‚Äúno‚Äù you‚Äôre lying to yourself. It‚Äôs okay, right now you feel like crap and it feels like everything absolutely 100% sucks....but give it a little time....you‚Äôll think of a good memory.....and perhaps (probably) there will be a good time in your future that you wouldn‚Äôt have imagined.  That‚Äôs all I have for now. Reading a lot of your entries from less than a half a day ago, I am praying more than anything you all hang on, and I‚Äôm here for anyone.

No, it hurts more now I'm not hiding from the pain by obsessively counting calories and trying to shrink.  It's meant to be BETTER on the other side.  I'M meant to feel better.  But I just feel worse.  Emotionally tired. Drained.  To make matters worse, the one I could depend on isn't available.  After over 20yrs, that person is distant.  They were one of my last hopes.  Even that's gone.  Does. It. Ever. Get. Better. Than. This?  The suicidal thoughts came back on Saturday night.  Again yesterday.  And today. I guess I'm so worthless and repulsive that no one will even look at this.  But at least it means no one will stop me from trying to kill myself properly next time.

I hope I‚Äôm coming out the other end! So, I haven‚Äôt been to work in about a month. It became too much for me. Dealing with life and people. Comparing myself to other people is tough for me. It is how I gauge my progress in life. The shitty (good) thing is that my life is pretty okay. I have a loving family and great friends.   Life had gotten to be too much. Sometimes I feel like my life is a cosmic joke. Keep in mind, I‚Äôve just come to terms with the fact that there is no god or after life. As a devout Christian, this has been tough!  I reached out to my family and some mental health professionals. It wasn‚Äôt easy but I did it. The days after got better until they didn‚Äôt. I took a major step backwards and lost my shit, again. I thought for sure I was going to end it.   I have a plan, I have the means to do it, and I‚Äôve written a letter. What I haven‚Äôt done is kill myself. Some days it is all I can think about and it is what I want to do more than anything.   Today I do not want to kill myself for the first time in weeks. I hope this can be an encouragement to myself (if/when I come back to read this) and others. Even if it feels like all hope lost, I am trying to be hopeful that the things that being me joy and happiness will once again bring me joy and happiness.   Just for today, just right now, in this very minute, I do NOT want to kill myself and that is the most hope I‚Äôve had in weeks.

Found out ex attempted suicide by overdose after she called me. She's in ICU after I called emergency services even though she was against it. I don't want her to be upset with me. What can I do for when she recovers and to prevent her from doing it again? I'm so¬†sorry this is long and detailed.¬†  She was my work colleague for 2 months before she moved on and¬†I got to know her properly. We were together for almost 3 years and left on really good terms. We left because we knew it was too much work for both of us - I'm Christian and part-Palestinian, she's Jewish and part-Israeli. We were so deep in the relationship but also hesitant. Hesitant because of our family's reaction to our sexuality,¬†religious and ethnic backgrounds. But I went into it because I knew there was a chance for a long term relationship - both of us worked in London and far away from our families who live outside the city.  She's Cambridge educated and one of the brightest and quickest minds in one of the most difficult and prestigious careers you could get into. So, my mind told me I didn't need to check on her all those months - she was definitely doing well after moving on from me and finding someone else.   She placed a missed call yesterday¬†morning¬†and I¬†called back later that night¬†to check why.¬†I was anxious to pick up¬†because her call¬†meant something serious. She told me she called to hear my voice and apologise for telling me we couldn't work out.   I knew something was up so tried¬†to stay as calm as possible. I told her it was lovely to hear from her, asked her¬†where she was, if anyone was with her¬†etc. and she told me she was alone¬†in her flat, she apologised for calling earlier and that she was just dealing with a small overdose. I knew I had to get her medical attention¬†. We finished the call without me telling her I was driving to her flat.  I got to¬†her flat and told her I just wanted to see her, to¬†speak to her. She let me in and we were so quiet. Nobody spoke for about 15 minutes,¬†until I noticed she was getting off the sofa and I just went up to her and held her really tight. I didn't¬†want her to leave, I didn't¬†want her to go out of my sight for a second. I knew I had to be extra careful with my words to get her to come with me to the hospital. We sat talking about everything¬†for a good 4 or so hours and I could tell she was in visible pain. I tried to be as subtle as possible, told her let's go together and check on you, just a quick check to see what's going on but it'll¬†ultimately be your choice whether you want that treatment or not. She told me she wouldn't go, that she just wanted to wait at home for everything to end. We were silent for a while after she said that. I¬†felt¬†like I fucked up with my words because she¬†didn't¬†budge. I left her flat and just sat in the car,¬†I couldn't just sit at home and¬†let it happen. I walked¬†back to her flat a few hours later, called emergency services and begged for her to come, just for a check up and somehow convinced her when they arrived.  I don't¬†know what to do, I¬†could only call those who knew about our relationship (all but one are¬†outside the city), so¬†I have almost no physical¬†support. I've not slept in so long and called in sick for work today. What do I do if she gets upset with me?¬†What can I do to help prevent this being repeated in the future? Please just anything you think helped you or someone you know.¬†

Feeling Guilty About Feelings During Pandemic...? I'm in Ontario, Canada, so currently we aren't under any lockdown or anything that extensive. However, it seems like we are heading in that direction. I have really poorly managed anxiety, we've been playing with my meds for months now. Almost a year ago I had a pretty serious suicide attempt, and it's been a waiting game since then to try and get me back on track due to the lack of access to the appropriate medical services.  Anyways, I feel guilty for becoming suicidal during the pandemic. There's so much else happening everywhere (there's no cases in my town), that I feel bad for even considering killing myself but that guilt is what's driving me to the edge. I feel like it's only a matter of  time before I snap. I live alone and I'm terrified that if they quarantine us I won't be able to see my caseworker or my therapist. I've been seeing someone twice a week most weeks because I can't make it more than a few days without going into extreme distress. It doesn't help that I'm coming out of a manic episode. I'm  terrified of being locked in my apartment alone, and I'm scared that i don't know what's happening. I don't even care about the virus. If I get it, I'm a high risk, so it might be bad. But we don't have any cases here. I'm more worried about the actions of other people. I have severe gastroparesis and I'm just so done with living a this point because I'm in such a horrible flare. I can't eat anything. The things I can eat everyone is emptying the shelves of (panic buying soup and rice...etc).   I  don't know what to do.  Ifeel like I can't go to the hospital to reach out for help and support when I'm in crisis, but I also can't keep doing this. My classes got cancelled and I'm thinking that I will be out a job next week most likely (based on how things are going right now) as well...please help I don't know what to do, I know deep down I want to live and that's why I'm reaching out but right now I'm losing all of my reasons. I've been staying in bed all day everyday and that's usually one of the final signs for me.

Do I actually want to be alive? Everyday I wake up and ask myself one question. ‚ÄòDo I actually want to be alive?‚Äô. Everyday since I was 12 I‚Äôve asked myself this question. The answer varies, but the most consistent has been a firm no. Yet, here I am. Breathing, blinking and alive. Even I‚Äôm not sure why.    There is a pit in the bottom of my stomach, like there is a piece of me missing. It‚Äôs like somethings wrong but I can‚Äôt put my finger on it. I know what‚Äôs wrong, I‚Äôve been told by multiple medical professionals, it‚Äôs just clinical depression. A lack of neurotransmitters or whatever has ruined my entire existence apparently. I don‚Äôt believe them. Surely, if that was the case, my antidepressants would cure me. But they don‚Äôt. 40mg of fluoxetine a day and I‚Äôm sat here wanting to kill myself again.    The truth is it doesn‚Äôt get better. That‚Äôs the whole goddamn truth, it is for me anyway. My conclusion is that I‚Äôm fundamentally broken. No drugs, life style changes or talking will fix me.    Do I actually want to be alive?  No.
